main event: On various occasions between April 1948 and April 1966, multiple witnesses reported seeing unidentified flying objects in the sky, primarily in Delaware and Ashley, Ohio.
interesting points: The witnesses described the objects as spherical or cylindrical in shape, one witness likened it to a stiff batter or dough dropped from a spoon., There was no sound reported coming from the objects, and they often moved slowly against the wind., Several sightings referenced clear weather conditions with no clouds near the objects., The objects displayed unusual characteristics, including a defined shape and brightness against the sky., Witness accounts involved multiple individuals collaborating on their observations of these unidentified aerial phenomena.
sighted object: spherical or cylindrical unidentified flying objects
witness description: Various individuals including a pastor, a newspaper reporter, and other local residents.
